intro: Psychotria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria longipes is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
